description: two seated nudes at center, in a landscape; putto at LRC; two dogs at LLC; drapery at right behind figures and drapery study at top
markings: on verso, bottom center: rooster stamp (Lugt 2811b)
medium: Pen and brown ink and wash, black chalk and gray wash
provenance: Carl Robert Rudolf, Lugt 2811b (1884-1974) London; Prof. Moir, Santa Barbara (until 2009; given to MIA).
text: Jacopo Palma il Giovane was influential in the generation after Titian, Jacopo Tintoretto, and Paolo Veronese. During the last quarter of the 16th century, Palma became the most esteemed artist in Venice and was hired to paint allegorical scenes for the interior walls of the Doges Palace, the seat of Venetian government. Later in life, Palma painted mythological subjects for Venetian intellectuals, and this study of Venus and Adonis dates to that period.
title: Venus and Adonis
